intro: Pseuduvaria phuyensis, commonly known as the Phuyen pseuduvaria, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like India and Myanmar. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
